title: Donald Trump wants more nuclear weapons so US is 'top of the pack' | Metro News
text:
Toby Meyjes for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 8:55 pm Donald Trump has said he wants to build the US’ nuclear arsenal (Picture; Metro.co.uk/Mylo/Getty) 
Donald Trump has said he wants to build up the United States’ nuclear arsenal to make sure it is ‘top of the pack’. 
The president told Reuters that he believes the US has fallen behind in its atomic weapons capacity. What is Maha Shivaratri and why is it celebrated? 
In his first comments about the U.S. nuclear arsenal since his inauguration, Trump said the United States has ‘fallen behind on nuclear weapon capacity.’ 
‘I am the first one that would like to see everybody – nobody have nukes, but we’re never going to fall behind any country even if it’s a friendly country, we’re never going to fall behind on nuclear power. 
‘It would be wonderful, a dream would be that no country would have nukes, but if countries are going to have nukes, we’re going to be at the top of the pack.’ 
The president said he believes the US has fallen behind in its atomic weapons capacity. (Picture: REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst) Trump also said China could ‘very easily’ solve the national security challenge posed by North Korea ‘if they want to’. (Picture: REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst) 
The new strategic arms limitation treaty, known as New START, between the U.S. and Russia requires that by February 5, 2018, both countries must limit their arsenals of strategic nuclear weapons to equal levels for 10 years 
The treaty permits both countries to have no more than 800 deployed and non-deployed land-based intercontinental and submarine-launched ballistic missile launchers and heavy bombers equipped to carry nuclear weapons, and contains equal limits on other nuclear weapons. 
In the interview, Trump called New START ‘a one-sided deal’. 
‘Just another bad deal that the country made, whether it’s START, whether it’s the Iran deal … We’re going to start making good deals,’ he said. 
Ivanka Trump (righ) joins her father U.S. President Donald Trump (Picture: REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst) 
In the same interview the Republican also complained about Russia’s deployment of a cruise missile in violation of an arms control treaty. 
He said he would raise the issue with Russia President Vladimir Putin when the pair meet. 
In a wide-ranging interview, Trump also said China could ‘very easily’ solve the national security challenge posed by North Korea ‘if they want to’. 
The interview, that took place in the Oval Office, also saw Trump declare himself ‘very angry’ at the Kim Jong-un’s ballistic missile tests. More
